title: Function Concepts - Graphical and Analytical: Rational

content.question: Part A (i) The function <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is defined by <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses g ring operator f close parentheses open parentheses x close parentheses equals g open parentheses f open parentheses x close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo>∘</mo><mi>f</mi></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>. Find the value of <math alttext="h open parentheses 6 close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mn>6</mn></mfenced></math> as a decimal approximation, or indicate that it is not defined. Show the work that leads to your answer. (ii) Find all real zeros of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math>, or indicate there are no real zeros.

frqParts.text: Part A (i) The function <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is defined by <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals open parentheses g ring operator f close parentheses open parentheses x close parentheses equals g open parentheses f open parentheses x close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo>∘</mo><mi>f</mi></mrow></mfenced><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>. Find the value of <math alttext="h open parentheses 6 close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mn>6</mn></mfenced></math> as a decimal approximation, or indicate that it is not defined. Show the work that leads to your answer. (ii) Find all real zeros of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math>, or indicate there are no real zeros.

Part B (i) Find all values of <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>, as decimal approximations, for which <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals negative 5.8"><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>5.8</mn></math>, or indicate that there are no such values. (ii) Determine the end behavior of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> as <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> decreases without bound. Express your answer using the mathematical notation of a limit.

Part C (i) Is the function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> invertible? (ii) Give a reason for your answer in part C(i) based on properties of the function \(f\). Refer to points on the graph of \(f\) in your reasoning.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Solve equations and inequalities represented analytically, with and without technology.
